auditorium

Class SynchronizedQueue<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • auditorium.SynchronizedQueue<T>

  • public class SynchronizedQueue<T>
extends java.lang.Object
    This is an implementation of a synchronized queue (LIFO push/pop policy) which holds S-Exprssions. I wrote it because Java's collections API is inherently confusing, and if i used Collections.synchronizedList(), my intuition tells me that something dangerous might happen.

    This class is implemented using a java.util.LinkedList, interpreting it as a java.util.Queue, and synchronizing push and pop on "this."

    A call to pop(), when the queue is empty, will block until something gets placed in the queue.

    • Method Detail

      • push

        public boolean push(T exp)
        Call this method to add a new S-Expression to the queue.
        Parameters:
        exp - This is the expression that wants to be added to the queue.
        Returns:
        This method returns true if the add was a success, or false otherwise.

      • pop

        public T pop()
      throws ReleasedQueueException
        Call this method to remove the least recently added S-Expression from the queue.
        Returns:
        This method returns the least recently added S-Expression, or returns null if the queue is empty.
        Throws:
        ReleasedQueueException - This method throws if it deems it cannot ever get any input. This determination is made if another thread calls releaseThreads().

      • size

        public int size()
        Get the number of elements that are in the queue.
        Returns:
        This method returns the number of elements that are in the queue.

      • releaseThreads

        public void releaseThreads()
        If any threads are waiting on a pop operation, release them. This operation is not recoverable (subsequent pop operations will not block).
